item.title: Save OKC Schools launches 90-day petition drive for local income tax
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Phylesia Dailey thinks her daughter is getting a good education at Cleveland Elementary in Oklahoma City Public Schools. She also believes all children in the district should have the kind of good education her daughter is receiving. “Right now we happen to be lucky enough to be in a good school attendance area,” said Dailey. […]

The post Save OKC Schools launches 90-day petition drive for local income tax appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Local income taxes proposed to support OKC schools
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City residents will pay a ¼ of 1 percent extra income tax to support local schools if voters approve a plan by one pro public education group. Save our Oklahoma City Schools Coalition held a news conference on the steps of City of Oklahoma City Hall Thursday to explain the plan. “The City of […]

The post Local income taxes proposed to support OKC schools appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Consolidation of small OKCPS schools postponed
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Small neighborhood elementary schools in Oklahoma City Public Schools will remain in place for the 2017-18 school year. The decision to spend another year studying the issue of the cost effectiveness of all OKCPS schools came after six public forums Superintendent Aurora Lora held at the schools that were to be closed. “I know in […]

The post Consolidation of small OKCPS schools postponed appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Consolidation plan would close NE Academy, five other schools
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Northeast Academy and five elementary schools may close as soon as next year because of a new consolidation plan proposed Monday night. The plan is a response to continuing state budget problems being passed down to Oklahoma City Public Schools. “We’ve run out of easy solutions,” said Superintendent Aurora Lora Monday night as she acknowledged […]

The post Consolidation plan would close NE Academy, five other schools appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Into 2017 – Mélon begins third year at OKCPS Foundation
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Mary Mélon started her third year as the president and CEO of the Foundation for Oklahoma City Public Schools in September. And she is upbeat about what has been accomplished and what is in store for 2017. Mélon sat down with Free Press a few days before Christmas to reflect on her last two years with […]

The post Into 2017 – Mélon begins third year at OKCPS Foundation appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Work Experience is also way to pay tuition in Cristo Rey schools
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
It’s a private school whose founder says, “If you can afford to come here, you can’t come.” Roman Catholic Jesuit priest Fr. John P. Foley developed that line when he started the first Cristo Rey high school in Chicago in 1996. It was what he would say to families who had significant money and wanted […]

The post Work Experience is also way to pay tuition in Cristo Rey schools appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
